description:
In middle school, Uka Ishimori was nicknamed “Stone.”

In order to change herself, she enrolled in Hachimitsu High School, known for its culture of student liberty. Seated in at the desk next to her in the same class is Kai Miura, a coolly freewheeling boy with lemon-colored hair. In truth, Uka met Kai once in middle school, and decided to attend Hachimitsu based on a single word he said to her.To Uka, the popular Kai is a distant presence.

Yet somehow, Kai starts to look after Uka. With Kai encouraging her, Uka gradually begins to fit in with her classmates…

But...Uka’s world is gradually changing with Kai’s presence. —

Now, I am in the center of the endlessly spreading light.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Website](https://www.mattgreenbaumvo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mattsgreenbaum) 

American voice actor and ADR writer.

&Team (English: andTeam, Japanese: エンティーム, Korean: 앤팀; stylized in all caps) is a Japanese boy band based in Japan and South Korea formed by HYBE Labels Japan. The group is composed of nine members: K, Fuma, Nicholas, EJ, Yuma, Jo, Harua, Taki, and Maki. They were formed through the reality-survival program &Audition – The Howling – as their label's first group. &Team released their debut single "Under the Skin" on November 21, 2022, and officially debuted with their first extended play First Howling: Me on December 7, 2022.
__Fumihiko Ootera__ is a Japanese recording engineer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.
